Hello everyone. Updating from airport lounge because I am slightly bored.

Leave nice messages below for me to read on my return (the 16th of the month- day beofre results... argh...)

Right I'm off to have another g and t.

Adios amigos.

<lj-cut text="You've probably all seen this anyway, but I thought it was brilliant.">

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KOPZxO-iw9Q&search=bbc%20news%2024%20apple

It's a clip from BBC News 24, live in the studio after the verdict of the Apple versus Apple Corps court case was announced.

They supposedly have their digital music expert in to talk about the effects that the judgement will have to consumers. The only the thing is, he isn't the expert they were after. He's just a cabbie they found at reception. Somehow they managed to take him onto the set, mic him up and question him about his expert opinion without him questioning anything.

The look on his face is actually amazing.</lj-cut>

"Brap, brap, brap! I'm gonna bust a cap in yo ass." "Ahhh! Help! Someone save me!" "I'll help you Miss Becky!" "No not you Francoise! Go Taki, help that damsel in distress!" "Aye aye cap'n. But where is my trusty steed?" "Mmmm... basque cake..." Will our hero Taki get to Miss Becky in time? Will Taki's trusty steed stop eating cake and come to the rescue? Will Francoise ever be a real boy? Find out in the next thrilling installment of... "POPE TREE DRAMA IV: THE RETURN OF MICK PARKER"
Why didn't they have the pole-vault though?
A quarter of a million pounds. 22 identical sealed boxes. And no questions... except one...

'Cos it's the rules...

1. Comment and I'll respond with something random about you.
2. I'll tell you what song/movie reminds me of you.
3. I'll pick a flavor of jello to wrestle with you in.
4. I'll say something that only makes sense to you and me.
5. I'll tell you my first memory of you.
6. I'll tell you what animal you remind me of.
7. I'll ask you something that I've always wondered about you.
8. If I do this for you, you must post this on your journal. You MUST.
The best synchronised dancing in a music video since OK GO I'm Alive by Vincent Vincent and The Villains (Takes a while to load, but is well worth it.)
Spent today at an English conference up in town, which was actually rather good. Four lecturers talked about Antony and Cleopatra for four hours. In more exciting news... I made changes, OK?!

I remember being mesmerised when I first saw this, therefore I am very happy to have found it again. Enjoy it. (Oh, and if you have a pop-up blocker, hold down control when you click the link, otherwise the video wont pop up. Stupid MTV.)

Just got the new Rakes song of their forum, 'Human, All Too Human'. Please listen to it. I need you, I need you, I seriously do. I'm not even drunk yet - I've only had a few. I love this band. Today was spent uttering the phrase 'Continue down the path to the double doors at the end, and you can register inside' far too many times (11+ exam day). Still managed to have a laugh though, whilst inventing some potential olypic sports (Duran Duran Skiing anyone?) Then went into Croydon with Nick, Becky, Jay, Charlotte and Simon, which was a good laugh. Nick ate a sub. Becky got her ear pierced. It looks dead cool. "You got me right where you want me..."
You guys probably have this on your friends page, but here is a list of a gazzillion Family Guy songs, if you're interested.
It saddens me that I can't use this as my display picture. Damn 40kb limit.
Another little present for Miss. Atherton (and anyone else who wants it)
Well this is one of the most creative Christmasses I've had for quite a while... Oh yeah...

Went to see King Kong with Nick after school today and it is actually amazing. Seriously - it's SO good (and it really didn't seem like we were in there for three hours). In honour of our hairy friend's revival I bring you... It started off in 1933: Note the youthful Kong - clear complection, no bags under the eyes and rather toned upper body. Mr. Kong's second (proper) coming came in the mid '70s: Note how he still retains the youthful look, but seems to have let himself go a bit... The big K also features in the '74s smash hit 'King Kong versus Godzilla': See how he seems to have made a new friend in the shape of what seems to be a hybrid of a t-rex meets the tin-man from The Wizard of Oz Finally, the King of The Swingers returns to our screen this week: At over 70 years old, Kong is looking great for his age (scars around the eyes suggest he's had a little nip and tuck, but hey, who hasn't in Hollywood!). Looks like he can still pick up the ladies too. Literally. Yes, I was bored.
Ahhh, all Christmassy. Now let me see yours!

Proper update later. Probably.

I thought I may as well update this, because it's either that or watch ITV feed a number of celebrities to sharks. Wait that sounds more appealing having written that. Oh well. So I went to Spain for a week which was rather good - it mainy involved drinking gin and playing poker by the pool, so yeah, it was fun. Back to school on Tuesday - is it just me, or did that holiday go really quickly? An activity day or summit, so shouldn't be too bad. Oh and finally, will someone please kick this man for me.

Thought I may as well update this, seeing as I have nothing to do. Well my sister's off to Sheffield Uni at the end of September which will be weird really, her leaving home and all that. However this does mean I will conveniently be able to arrange trips to go up and see her and also see a number of top Sheffield bands playing on their home turf (hopefully). Tent is in shipshape condition for next weekend, but i need to somehow make it standout amongst the billions of others, any ideas? Results a week today... Oh well... And to round of this brilliant post, I give you a picture of the world's ugliest dog (no, seriously, it won awards)

Yes, OK, I admit it: I am officially sad - I'm updating my livejournal from the departure lounge at the airport :$

But I just thought you might like to know you can book your tickets for Art Brut at The Cartoon here ( http://www.ticketweb.co.uk/user/?region=uk&query=detail&event=134116&interface=glasswerk1 ) I've already got mine and have one spare ticket. I say everybody buy a ticket and we make the 6th of October Joe's Official birthday (The Queen has two, so why can't Joe)

Right I'm off now, I have a plane to catch!

Farewell.

I leave you all with some music:

'Say Something' by Komakino - http://s22.yousendit.com/d.aspx?id=0B70WN70QG9HM1DCWTYID8LB96

'Japanese Punk' by The Rotters - http://s22.yousendit.com/d.aspx?id=2W5UFJJ5WUHE70CCJFA4SIY4BA

Adios!

Well I'm off tomorrow for a couple of weeks, so I thought I'd let you know (yes, I knew you'd all be interested to know that). I need to keep myself entertained on the plane, any ideas? Oh and in more shocking revelations, Art Brut are playing THE CARTOON in October!!!!?!?!? How quaint...

As everybody knows, it's Becky's birthday today. Therefore we, Joe's Jacket, racked our brains as to what we could offer as a present. Having thought for, ooh a few seconds, we come up with this little ditty. Enjoy Becky and HAPPY BIRTHDAY! Oh, and you can listen to what else we recorded today at www.joesjacket.tk if you're really that interested.
Just to let you know, http://www.joesjacket.tk is now up and running. Take a look around, sign up to the forum and tell your friends!

Thought I'd update this 'cos I haven't done so for a while. Today was rather fun (picnic in Lloyd Park - party rings, oh yes), but also quite sad as it was Nick's last day in the country :( He is coming back for a few days in a couple of weeks time, so it's not all bad (and it sounds like anothher excuse for a party-shaped thing). Teh party on Saturday and then Tin Pan Alley festival on Sunday which should be good, but I'm running out of money which is not so good.

For all those myspace fanatics, have a gander at this - http://www.myspace.com/joesjacket You can listen to a few of our songs here, and just generally hurl abuse at us. Enjoy!

It was true :(

'...im really sorry to tell you that the rumours we have split up are true. those of you close to us know that we have been sailing through choppy sea's for some time, putting on a brave face and running on the driven belief that we could weather the storm and come out the other side stronger for it. unfortunatley we have not found our clear blue skies. 
ultimately, i believe being in a band should be fun, it should affirm your life and change it for the better and none of us were happy with the situation. to get through tough times a band needs a shared aim, a common desire and charlie didnt share our ambitions. it couldnt work, it was an uphill struggle with no visible end. 
im afraid this is the best explanation i can offer, and if it seems inadaquate im sorry, but its breaking my heart writing this. 
all your kind words and support have not fallen on deaf ears, we value all of you and would like to say thankyou for everything, it has been our pleasure. we are sorry if you feel let down. 
we are in the process of deciding which forth comming gigs to play, if any, so keep checking the forum for information as Vincent will certainly be doing shows, as will alex. 
thankyou to all of you again, im just so sorry. MR NEILL V'

RIP Vincent Vincent and The Villains. <strike>Lets all go see one of their last dates:</strike>

<strike>SATURDAY JULY 2nd - BLOW UP, METRO, OXFORD STREET. Anyone wanna come?</strike> Date of Dominic's tramp party. Oh well, maybe see them another time...

Wireless was absolutely brilliant (thank you very much Bethany!) - there was hardly anyone there which made it all the more better (there were only about a hundred or so people watching Yeti)

And now some very sad news...

APPARENTLY, Vincent Vincent and The Villains have split up!!! Hope this one ain't true...
One of the best music videos I have ever seen - http://www.xlrecordings.com/broadcast/~damndamnleash/

...for this extremely pointless post, but a startling similarity has just occurred to me (OK, so I saw it in a TV guide...) SOME BLOKE FROM EMMERDALE and THE LION FROM 1939 CLASSIC MOTION PICTURE "THE WIZARD OF OZ" Spooky, non?

I'm rather bored, so someone entertain me. Geogrpahy is a pain in the back side - 22 frickin' case studies to learn :(
Maths is also rather depressing.

In partially better news Be Your Own Pet have been added to the Carling Stage on the Saturday at Reading which should be good.

Today was rather fun actually - went up to London with Sam, Taki and Kimberley. We did, however, get on a train which decided to breakdown thirty seconds before reaching Victoria, which meant a 3 HOUR wait. On a cramped train. However, we managed to entertain (*cough*) those around us with beautiful renditions of some classic sing-a-longs on Sam's acoustic. We were also interviewed by some freelance journalist who was gonna send the finished article to the NME or something or other...

Then we went on to a park in Shoreditch and the pub and was all rather grand.

By the way, here is The New Fellas for those who wanted it: http://s14.yousendit.com/d.aspx?id=1O5WWNXUZTLBE070JD3ES4F8UA
